comment: Walter Thain was a great professor for Electronics. Glad to have have taken him during his final semester.

Class was pretty easy, exams are easy and you'll be prepared for them as long as you do the homework. Labs were the most challenging part of the class, but still not bad. Admittedly, his lecturing style is real boring, but he knows so much about everything EE. Very wise man with a wealth of experience. Super chill and nice guy, I'd take him again.

Second time taking him. Yes the lectures are boring but you're not required to come he also records lectures so you can just watch it at a really fast speed of just check for thing you need for the hw and test. He also posts slides and has test guides taken from the slides. He's an easy enough A if you know what you're doing, just come to Lab.
tbh he's a chill guy boring lectures but he gives test guides follow that and your good, hws arent that crazy either
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Lectures are pretty standard, uses PowerPoints and works through examples. Records lectures and puts PowerPoints online which is super useful. Homework is often more difficult than test questions for better or worse but allows a cheat sheet during tests. Overall if you do the work and study before tests it's an easy class to pass.

rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: His lectures are quite bland, but stick to the homework and ask questions. Tough professor, but you just need to put in effort to get the grade. I believe he is an understanding guy, go see him during office hours if you still need help. He knows what he is doing, he understands the material. He gave extra credit towards the end, which was great:)
Very bad professor, best to avoid
He had very boring lectures and he doesnt work well with students
He is just a powerpoint reader, works examples off of said powerpoint, doesn't like answering questions, I would find another professor. I spent alot of time teaching myself the material.

No extra credit Tests have nothing to do with the material in class or homework Better read that book to understand what he is talking in class He assumes you know everything from the previous classes and doesn't review anything.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Thain is a horrible professor, unfair, and makes no sense. he will contradict himself and truly not care about his students.  I would not recommend taking this professor.

Very knowledgeable and helpful to those who ask. Lectures can be a little monotone but he explains everything you need to know for the test and then some. Records the lectures so you can watch them at home or a later date. He does a test review the day before and his tests are very straight forward.  I've taken him for 2 classes & would take more.

Very smart and knows what he is talking about. As long as you go to class, pay attention to the lectures and study a little before the tests you will be fine. Allows index card cheat sheets for tests!

If you can somehow stay awake through his lectures, you'll be alright.  I actually liked his class.  I feel that he did an outstanding job teaching the material.  If you want to do well on his tests, make sure you pay attention in class, labs and catch all the details.  Also, you have to actually read the book to score higher than a "B".

Had thain for Data Comm. Genuinely nice professor, extremely approachable. Test cover material he tells you to study and homework problems. Grading is fair, attendence isnt required but is recommended. There is alot of memorizing needed in this class, i missed a few days because of interviews and fell behind and it cost me points on the exam.

I had him for Electronics 1, and it was really good.  His lectures can get really boring sometimes, but you can just get his notes off the website and follow along.  It wasn't a cake-walk, but if you put in a little effort, it turns out real well.
